name: Sofitel Washington DC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked through Priceline, so of course we enjoyed our bidding price--But, I would have paid full price for this hotel. The staff far exceeded our expectations.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: I have just experienced an exceptional business meeting and weekend stay at this hotel. While I do not often use superlatives to describe the hotels I encounter in my business travels , I am compelled to make an exception in the case of the Sofitel DC!!
reviews.title: Outstanding customer service at the Sofitel DC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every aspect of the business meeting I hosted at the hotel came off perfectly. The staff went out of their way to ensure that everything, from the room layout to the refreshments, was to my satisfaction. The conference services department was especially helpful in working out the details with my assistant and handling the many details - allowing me to focus only the content of the meeting itself.
reviews.title: Absolutely Beautiful Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I followed the business meeting with an especially memorable weekend in Washington with my 13 year old son. Here too, it seemed that everyone on the hotel staff was there to make our stay enjoyable - with warm smiles and gracious hospitality. Mark at the concierge desk was most helpful with recommendations and reservations. I was especially impressed by his interactions with my son - making him feel like an especially important guest!
reviews.title: Definitely Stay Here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As I stated at the outset, such customer service at "chain" hotels catering to business travelers is (unfortunately) an exception these days. I found this hotel and its staff to be outstanding. I would higher recommend the place for both business and leisure travel!!
reviews.title: amazing hotel

likes.disliked: — parking may be expensive. I took the metro in

reviews.text: If you want an overall excellent experience while at the nation's Capitol, then the Sofitel is your place!
reviews.title: best service in DC, great location
what's all the fuss about?
reviews.text: I checked in on a Sunday evening (the first snowfall of the year) and was taken care of by a very friendly and knowledgeable front desk attendant. Upon settling into my room, I realized that I felt my cell phone in the car I had just dropped off to the valet. I went back downstairs, and told this to the same attendant that I had just checked in with. He immediately walked outside, in the 22 degree cold, snowy weather, walked 3 blocks to a parking garage and retreived my phone for me. This is excellent customer service that you won't find at most places!

reviews.title: perfect
reviews.text: The room was large, the bed was very comfortable and the door staff, valet, housekeeping, restaurant staff etc...were all very polite, friendly and professional. They truly made you feel like they appreciated you staying at their property (normally you feel like you're bothering the employees by staying at their hotel.)

reviews.title: Glad we stayed here
reviews.text: Yes, it's expensive (although I got a great off-season rate,) and the extras are expensive (valet, restaurant, room service) but those are all optional.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, I have nothing but good things to say about the Sofitel, and look forward to staying here again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel & Location

reviews.text: The Sofitel is not the biggest or the best hotel in Washington. It does not pretend to be. It is wonderfully located not far from the White house. It is gracefully fitted out.
reviews.title: The Staff were Fantastic

reviews.text: What was superb were the staff in particular Jean Paul. He was such an integral part of the Sofitel experience. Other staff were great too. My family felt so welcome as soon as we entered. We were sad to leave.
reviews.title: Business Travel
December stay
reviews.text: Would definitely recommend the Sofitel experience

I often travel to Washington for business. Every time I stay at the DC Sofitel I am impressed. The staff is always friendly, professional and goes out of their way to make you feel welcome. This is across the entire staff - from hotel management to check-in staff to the doormen. If there is ever a preference that you have, they note it for next time and are proactive in accommodating that preference. The rooms are very comfortable and the entire hotel has a wonderful feel. I have stayed at many hotels in many different cities for business and this property stands out as my favorite and the one I most look forward to coming back to.
reviews.title: Great location.

reviews.text: This hotel is fantastically situated in the centre of Washington. The room was clean tidy and tidy and the staff were all friendly and extremely helpful?
reviews.title: Can't wait to return!

reviews.text: We booked through Orbitz and got a cheap room rate (which I assume was because it was a weekend stay and off season for tourism). When we arrived our room was upgraded to an executive suite, which was hard to fault. The room and its factilities were great and the bed was very comfortable.
reviews.title: Hard to fault

reviews.text: Location wise, very close to the White House and a Tube Stop.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel!
Good LOcation for Downtown, unfortunately the rest of the stay didn't match
reviews.text: I would also recommend the Restaurant located in the hotel entrance - the food was excellent.

reviews.title: Understated Elegance, Great Location
reviews.text: We stayed overnight at the Sofitel on our way to South Carolina. It was fabulous. We were travelling with our 10 month old, and were not sure how he would be received at the hotel. All of the staff were wonderful. Our room was great, extremely quiet! We never heard a peep from any other guests. The room was quite spacious, very nicely decorated and clean. We also splurged on room service, and were not disappointed. Prompt, efficient service. Overall, we were very impressed with the service we received and will definitely consider booking with Sofitel when we travel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The proximity to the White House, given the price ($200), can't be beat! Although it was raining during our stay and hence we didn't get to explore the area as much as we wanted to, the location is excellent. An easy walking distance to The Mall, the Capitol Building, Washington Monument, etc.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: This is our first time in a Sofitel hotel.
reviews.title: Heavenly beds!!

reviews.text: We travel approx five times a year and require the highest standards as we are away from home a lot!
reviews.title: How do you suppose we looked?
Friendly Staff Made the Visit Special
reviews.text: We felt this hotel was comparable to a Four Seasons level. The room done in modern contempo and the beds was heavenly!!!
Next time we will look for a Sofitel property first!
reviews.title: Fabulous Stay--Amazing Bed & Bath

reviews.text: We arrived with three children after a day of soccer followed by hours of driving. How do you suppose we looked? Yet the staff greeted us like we were royalty. Every person from valet to consierge was warm and helpful. If only every hotel stay was like this.
reviews.title: Mixed reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sofitel was in a great location, only a couple blocks from the White House; 10-15 min walk to many restaurants, China Town, monuments, and the National Mall. The rooms were small, but clean (and I am fussy!). Small imperfections in the room, such as a small hole in the carpet, a sheet missing from the bed, etc-but the bed was so comfortable! I paid $160/night stayed in room 1006 (which has an awful view of the construction on the office building next door). I am happy with the price in relation to what I got (most important to me is location and cleanliness). I would not spend more than $160.
reviews.title: A Nice Hotel

reviews.text: The breakfast on New Years Day was ok: $20/person and had the typical American buffet; it was nothing special and next time I think I would go somewhere else for breakfast.
reviews.title: Mislead in cost of internet access

likes.disliked: — Not disclosing charges for internet and parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We tried to get a drink in the hotels bar but, after not being served for a few minutes decided to leave (the $13 martinis persuaded us as well...restaurants in the area had $9-$10 martinis.
reviews.title: OK- But nothing special

reviews.text: A piece of advice about DC: unless you like to go to a bar or club to celebrate, their NYE was pretty lame-no fireworks or anything provided by the city.
reviews.title: A Very Nice Experience

likes.disliked: — Not many restaurants in the area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, make reservations at restaurants for dinner.
reviews.title: Not for Romance

reviews.text: After checking out at the Sofitel New York, we were eager to see if their collegues in DC were able to provide us with the same level of service! Yvette at the front desk checked us in and gave a promise that they would be even better. Our room was facing the offices of the next building but we didnt mind. As in NYC, the windows appears to be soundproof, except for the occational sirens we heard nothing! The room was even spacier than Sofitel NYC. Same spotless standard! The aircon was VERY silent, now and then I had to check whether it was running or not.
reviews.title: An oasis in the capital

reviews.text: The location could not been better, a mere 10 minutes walk from the White House. And when it was getting really hot outside, it was a pleasure to return to this oasis every day. We didnt have dinner at the hotel but the breakfast was a feast. God I miss the orange juice! Best I have tasted in my life!
reviews.title: Perfect For a Short Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highy reccommended!! You will not be dissapointed!
reviews.title: This is it!

likes.liked: — Excellent service, good facilities, great value for money
likes.disliked: — Lack of coffee-making facilities and no pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is in so many ways a typical Sofitel – nice rooms, clean and well stocked bathrooms and attractive public spaces but I was surprised by some aspects of it.
reviews.title: Good hotel, good location, good staff - a few issues

reviews.text: We arrived at around 9pm and our reservation was dealt with quickly by a really charming front desk person. She confirmed all the details as booked and took time to explain the hotel facilities. First impression - the reception area, the bar, the business centre and the concierge desk are all very small which surprised me – it’s a large hotel with I think around 15 floors of rooms but the public area is very small indeed – although beautifully furnished and glossy.
reviews.title: Great place in the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room (5th floor) overlooked the street below which is one block from the White House. It had a comfortable king sized bed, large work desk and ergonomic chair plus one other small table and armchair (it really needed another armchair) The bathroom was standard Sofitel – clean and well stocked although no orchid and no candle like some others. Hotels of this standard usually offer 3 large bath towels but we had two large towels plus two robes and slippers. Toiletries are the standard Lanvin range (quite highly scented so take your own if you’ve got sensitive skin). Housekeeping was good but we returned with some bags one day and the room still wasn’t cleaned by around 3.30pm - which I think is too late.
reviews.title: Wonderful Service, Great Location, Luxurious Accomodations

reviews.text: The TV was large and had lots of channels although the picture quality wasn’t good but we only needed it to catch up on the weather so not a big problem. Wi-fi wasn’t included in the room rate but it was offered free at check in thanks to our A-Club loyalty card. Wi-fi speeds weren’t bad but they weren’t superfast either – if you were using it for work you may struggle.
reviews.title: Location Ideal ~ Hotel little bit of fancy
Excellent Location, Superb Service
reviews.text: I can see that others have mentioned the breakfast offering and indeed this was the worst aspect of the stay. We decided to have breakfast at the hotel simply as it was the most convenient option. In truth this was a mistake. The seating is limited (maybe 20 tables at most which means you have to wait at busy times) and the service is painfully slow and erratic. It took an age to get served, a long time for the food to arrive and even longer to get another drink.

reviews.title: A wonderful stay!
reviews.text: Our room was beautiful!!!! I sleep in a waterbed normally, and most hotel beds are like boards to me, but this bed was, without a doubt, one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in at a hotel. The comfortable bed with the wonderful linens...... I was in heaven. The bathroom was beautiful with a great shower. The room was well worth the price. We enjoyed a glass of wine at the outside tables at the end of each day after miles of walking and taking in the sights of DC. The concierge was helpful and the bartender friendly. The room was spotless and comfortable. What more could you ask for?

I recently stayed at the Sofitel Lafayette Square, after a superb time at the Water Tower property in Chicago a while ago. Both hotels deserve their ratings and reviews on Tripadvisor without a doubt. I was upgraded to a deluxe corner room, which was spacious, super clean, lovely designed, with the signature marble bathroom, just like the Water Tower. The beds are probably one of the nicest features. No flatscreen TVs as of yet, if you really care about that. Getting to the hotel from Reagan Airport and getting around Washington is a breeze, the McPherson square metro station is just a block away. The concierge can arrange a towncar to take you to Dulles if needed.
reviews.title: Sophisticated l'art de vivre at Sofitel

reviews.text: As most reviewers have said, the most noteworthy asset of this and other Sofitels is their staff - warm, polite, sincere, service-oriented without being overbearing. Internet is available for a charge in the rooms, but there is a business center just off the lobby with complimentary computers, internet, and printer. LeBar is a nice place for a coffee or cocktail, I did not have the opportunity to try the restaurant.
reviews.title: Cannot Compliment Enough!

likes.disliked: — cannot think of anything not on par

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check the Sofitel website for rates that offer great value for what you get. Would recommend it to anyone needing a hotel in DC.
reviews.title: Very Sophisticated
Yes Yes Yes
reviews.text: When I book a hotel, there are three things that are important to me: Location, luxury, and personal sevice. The Sofitel Lafayette Square provides all three in manner that is rarely matched anywhere else in the world.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights over the Thanksgiving holiday. The hotel was quiet which added to the pleasure and everything about the hotel and staff can only be described as great. The location is excellent. We got breakfast included and this was a bonus as it can work out expensive at nice hotels.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.text: I stayed 5 nights at the Sofitel Washington DC. Overall I was not impressed. Problems started at the check in with the requested room not being available and staff being very rude. Eventually I got the room but after 8 hours of flying I was not in the mood for rude staff especially considering that I'm an A-Club Platinum member and last year stayed over 90 nights at Sofitel hotels. They also had no clue about the rate I booked (50$ credit offer).
reviews.title: very mediocre Sofitel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was no luggage service so off I went with my luggage to my room which was small and definitely showed signs of ageing: wall paper peeling near the curtains, stains on carpets and for whatever reasons you can't open any of the windows in any of the rooms. None of my Platinum perks arrived throughout the trip. There is no proper turn down service, except a bottle of water, compare this with any other Sofitel around the world where you are showered with sweets and chocolates.
reviews.title: Everything is great! Stay at the Sofitel!

reviews.text: Breakfast is made to order and at least twice they got it wrong and another time I received the wrong check. Not overly impressive and expensive. Room service was marginally better and the staff very friendly (probably the best throughout my stay). The bar can be a bit overpowering if you don't like obscure loud Jazz. Not what I was looking for to have a quiet drink.
reviews.title: French Hotel in D.C. that does not celebrate Thanksgiving

reviews.text: Bathrooms are large and feature a pleasant large shower (same as the Sofitel NY).
reviews.title: Wonderful place, highly recommended

reviews.text: I have just returned from a fabulous stay at the Sotifel. The staff were wonderful, they treated my family and I as though we were the only guests staying in the hotel. From valet parking, front desk, housekeeping to restaurant staff you couldn't wish for better service.
reviews.title: Simply Presidential

reviews.text: The bedroom was decorated in a modern yet luxurious style. The beds were extremely comfortable...the shower superb...in fact I didn't want to get out of either! Bar and restaurant are excellent, the complimentary coffee and newspapers until 10am are a welcome touch.
reviews.title: Not Such a Good Experience

reviews.text: If you are travelling to Washington DC then stay here...you won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: View from a wheelchair in November 2005
Some people don't know they're born ....
reviews.text: Checked in on a Friday for a long weekend in Mid October. Arriving around 230PM we were made to wait until around 5PM to check in - due to late check outs. We were offered one complimentary glass of wine in the bar while waiting, were charged 10.00 for the additional glass. Upon checking in I enquired if the Sofitel chain was affiliated with either NWA or BA for frequent flier miles and the front desk rep had no idea. He did not volunteer to check on it for me either, just a simple I don't know. I would find it hard to believe I was the first person to ever ask about frequent flier miles but you never know.After we checked in our bags were not brought to our adjoining rooms like we were promised. Still more time wasted waiting for them. I was not given a key card for the outer door of our adjoining rooms, unfortunate for me I did not discover this till my friend and I split up to do different errands. The key kerfuffle was not handled well by the front desk...even more waiting while they got someone in security to make me the proper key. Around 1030PM Friday night I was awakened by Room Service entering my room. Apparently they had been knocking but I did not hear them ( the beds are very comfortable ). I did not think it was appropriate for them to just enter, especially when they had the wrong room. The coffee bar in the morning was nice. The last thing I did not appreciate was that on Sunday when I enquired about a late check out by 2 hours I was told NO, they had guests arriving that afternoon and needed the rooms ready by 3PM. That was interesting since it did not matter to them that I sat in the lobby about 2.5 hours on Friday due to late check outs. I have written well over a month ago to Sofitel Guest Relations with these and other concerns from my stay but they have yet to respond. I was unimpressed with their service and would not choose their hotel again. After spending 500 per room ( 1000 total ) for a weekend I expected a little more.

reviews.title: For business more than pleasure
reviews.text: Everywhere we went in the hotel was accessible - the staff are all charming and helpful.

reviews.title: Good quality hotel
reviews.text: We had a good stay here - close to the white house and bus/metro routes. A very smart hotel, clean and excellent service, with v good facitities - but more of a business hotel and geared towards that customer base, which made us feel a little uncomfortable as mere tourists. Prices at bar and bistro reflected that. As in the business district - very difficult to find places to eat in evenings that were a reasonable price - had to walk out of cbd to do so.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got a great deal on the Sofitel through Hotwire for a short trip over the Christmas holiday with my fiance, and it was worth every penny. The staff was incredibly attentive and accommodating, particularly when I inquired about avoiding paying for parking. Location can't be beat - one block from the White House and very close to museums and the Mall. Workout facilities were top notch, in fact, I think they were even better than my $100+/month gym. Also enjoyed the free coffee and tea in the morning; just grab a paper and you can spend at least an hour relaxing in the bar area. Our room was nicely appointed and the beds were insanely comfortable. Only complaint is that our extra Tempur-pedic pillow was missing from the closet. I would highly recommend this hotel and would return in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Amazing service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel during the Cherry Blossom festival. We were very happy with our decision. The room was very spacious, very clean and updated. It was our anniversary so they upgraded us, however, our room looked like the room pictured on their website, so I'm not sure if our room was any bigger or had any additional amenities.
reviews.title: Completely Satisfied

likes.disliked: — Lack of food in area during weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was very nice, lots of marble, and a separate glass enclosed shower and tub. There was also a nice 42" flat screen (LCD) television with High Def programming. Very nice, even though we didn't spend much time in the room to view it.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not much a view from the window, just basically other buildings, but at least they were architectually pleasing to the eye.
reviews.title: This place is top notch!

likes.liked: — The beds and pillows were great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just spent the weekend here, and the Sofitel is our very favorite in Washington. We have stayed at almost all of the major hotels in the city and this is our second trip to the Sofitel. This time reinforced the positive experience we had there the first time.
reviews.title: Our Favorite Hotel in Washington, D.C.
A good stay
reviews.text: It has a quiet elegance, an extremely helpful and friendly staff, lovely rooms, and it is all spotlessly clean. You just feel relaxed and taken care of. And it is a great value, as well.
The concierge, Cynthia , was so helpful and gracious. She was able to get us a lovely dinner reservation at Kinkead's
reviews.title: Beyond Snooty

likes.liked: — Location very close to White House/National Mall
likes.disliked: — The staff were so snooty they were insulting

reviews.text: and assisted us with directions to several colleges on Sunday. She is extremely professional and her welcoming attitude reinforced how great a hotel experience we had. We are quite fussy and the experience exceeded our expectations.
reviews.title: Small, expensive and pretentious

reviews.text: M G - New Jersey
reviews.title: Ridiculous price for shabby room

reviews.text: Spent a weekend at the Sofitel at the beginning of May. The location of the hotel couldn't be better, centrally located to everything one would want to see on a weekend visit. The room was exceptionally nice, clean and well equipped. The bathroom has a large tub, separate shower and wonderful amenities. The only negative with this hotel is the unfriendly attitude of the staff. Not rude, just "couldn't be bothered" and slow. In addtion, tried to contact the hotel several times regarding a left behind item. I was always transferred to voicemail and never received a response to my message. The service and attitude at this hotel keeps it at "good" vs. great.
reviews.title: Great Location, poor service.
Fabulous hotel
reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed at theSofitel for 12 days in April. It had all the features I was looking for. Extremely clean and extremely quiet, considering the downtown location. I asked for an upgrade due to our lengthy stay and they gave me a room with a great view.
Also, it was only 1 block from the Metro. which made it convenient.
reviews.title: Wonderful DC Hotel

reviews.text: The staff, especially all the conciege went out of their way to be helpful.
reviews.title: Need improvement in customer service

reviews.text: The doorman, Mike, was great. Always curtious and pleasant.
reviews.title: The Staff is Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just spent 5 days at this hotel - it was incredibly convenient - right near the White House - the staff was incredible - especially the consierge - he went out of his way to help us. 1/2 price on week-ends so it was a real deal for the price.
reviews.title: Excellent Service

reviews.text: I stayed at the Sofitel Lafayette for one night in May while in DC on business. I usually stay in Kimpton hotels while on business but, for some reason, I was booked at a Sofitel this time around. I'm thrilled that it worked out that way.
reviews.title: Real Class

reviews.text: My experience at Kimpton hotels have been a lot of attitude with little service. But, at this Sofitel, which you could tell was super high class, the staff was kind and helpful. There was no attitude at all, only good humored, happy people. Everyone from the front desk to the restaurant staff was more than gracious.
reviews.title: Sleek modern downtown hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was nice and looked out at the American Bar Association. I was only a couple of blocks from the White House, so that's what I did first thing upon arrival. Super close to both Metrorail as well as bus access.
reviews.title: Faultless

reviews.text: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. The staff were without exception welcoming and friendly. The room was refreshingly modern and immaculate. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was well supplied and beautiful.
reviews.title: perfect plus

reviews.text: Stayed here three times in the last year, most recently in early December for 2 nights. Low-key and relaxed is how I'd describe the place each time I've stayed. (Been there on both weekdays and weekends). The service (from doormen, to concierge to front desk) is friendly and attentive but not overbearing.
reviews.title: Really Good Hotel.
Above Average, But Not the Best
reviews.text: The lobby never feels crowded or too busy. I love grabbing a drink at the lobby bar - rich, warm colors and comfortable seating. (You can eat there too, but I haven't tried the food. I think they primarily serve small appetizers from the connected restaurant, but I'm not sure.) Music is not so loud that you can't have a conversation.

The rooms are also warm and inviting in design. The bed is very comfortable. Bathroom is great too, though the separate tub seems to be a waste considering its rather small size isn't exactly inviting to anyone over 5'6". My only real complaint though is that the small TV and clock radio are noticeably out-dated and feel completely out-of-place in the room. A flat screen and a radio/cd player that you could plug your mp3 player into definitely should be std in a hotel like this.
reviews.title: Palatial comfort at the Sofitel

likes.disliked: — I could n ot fault the accommodation I was given.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bottom line is that over the last two years I've stayed in a number of hotels in DC (Park Hyatt, Hotel Madera, Washington Court, Hotel George, Fairmont, etc.), and this one's my favorite.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for five nights in December. It's a small hotel and we had a good experience. It's a solidly above average hotel, but I don't think it deserves the # 1 rating. For example, the staff was very nice, but it doesn't have a pool, there is only one bar, and there is no spa.
reviews.title: The best hotel in DC

likes.disliked: — They only offer valet and for overnighters it is $35 (including garage tax).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel for three nights right before Thanksgiving. We could not have had a better time or stayed at a nicer hotel. The location was great. We walked everywhere and always knew how to get back to the hotel due to the direction from the Washington Monument. If you could find the monument - which was easy - you could find your way back. The hotel staff were the best part of the hotel. Jameson and Laura were the ideal Front Desk Guru's. They could answer any questions and were fun to deal with. The concierge, Andrew, was great. He was personable, charming and had great restaurant recommendations. He made all our dinner reservations - and got us both great tables and great restaurants. Germain - the great gentleman who helped with the baggage was a delight to joke with. The room was beautiful and the room service was great. We enjoyed wonderful desserts in the most comfortable bed after a long day of sightseeing. Coffee in the morning was delicious and served to our room quickly. The shower was powerful and the room spotless. All in all, this hotel is a great place to stay in a great location with a great staff.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Sofitel

reviews.text: The Sofitel Layfayette Square is a very elegant hotel. The place is very clean, the rooms and particularly the bathrooms are beautifully designed and decorated. The beds are some of the best I've ever slept on. The staff are exceptionally polite and helpful. Nonetheless, I don't think I'll stay here again, for a few reasons that are mostly the result of my own relatively minor gripes about what makes a hotel stay comfortable for me.
reviews.title: Good hotel, a few gripes

reviews.text: 1) Many rooms face alleyway. It seems like at least a quarter of the rooms face a dark alleyway in the back of the hotel. There is another building across this alleyway, so when the curtains are open, you are literally "on display" to the office workers in this other building. Further, this alleyway is busy with deliveries and trash removal fairly constantly, so there's quite a bit of noise. Lastly, this alleyway is blindingly illuminated at night. In short, the shades of your room need to be drawn pretty much 24 hours a day.
reviews.title: problems remedied

reviews.text: 2) No thermostat in rooms. I tend to like my room on the cold side, and my guess is the room was kept at about 75 degrees, night and day, which made it pretty stuffy for me.
reviews.title: 5 Stars for the Sofitel

reviews.text: 3) No coffee in the room. I tend to need coffee right when I wake up, and there is no coffee pot in the room. There is free coffee in the lobby, which means you have to make yourself at least somewhat presentable before you venture downstairs.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay at Sofitel Washington DC

likes.liked: — The impeccable attention to detial from everyone on staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The high rating is spot on. Beautiful hotel, small enough to get to your room quickly, very attentive staff, good food n the dining room, and quick attention to a minor problem in the room. 2 blocks from the White House. Good value; could have spent a couple of hundred dollars more per night and not gotten better room or service.
reviews.title: Deserves the high rating. Excellent in service and location

reviews.text: I'm a musician that travels all over the world and has stayed at great hotels. I got some good rest at the Sofitel DC. When in DC I'm working for Black Entertainment Television ( B.E.T ) doing a show for 2 weeks. My problem wasn't until I left DC the first week. I forgot a Playstation Vita in my room. We left about 5 a.m so no house keeping was going on at that time. At about 5:30 I realized that I'd left it so I called a told the the front desk my room number, what I forgot and where it was. They told me that they would tell house keeping to put it in lost and found, but not at the lost and found in there pocket. Yes they stole it!! I came back the next week to work and NO ONE KNOWS WHERE IT IS. So you mean to tell me " I leave at 5 a.m, call at 5:30, nobody has the key to my room but The Sofitel Hotel, house keeping comes in, and now I can't find my belongings. THE HOUSE KEEPING PEOPLE ARE THEIFS. NO RESPECT FOR PEOPLES STUFF. So I say don't leave anything or you will NEVER see it again.
reviews.title: Great stay BUT!!!!! THEIF STOP THEIF.......................

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service from this Hotel is excellent. Staff are very good and provide consistent service at a high level. Paul, Brian, Brita, Freedie are excellent in the restaurant and Allan does a really good job for customers in the Bar and Lounge area. Only gripe was that we had to wait about 2 hours for a room after having been on a 17 hour flight . Not pleasant. Staff did try and expedite room . Pity as we specifically requested an early check in
reviews.title: Excellent Value from Sofitel
Great location close to White House
reviews.text: The Sofitel Washington was a great choice with easy access to national mall and surrounding restaurants, but also the metro station!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I met her brother and wife from the mid-west at the Sofitel DC in April for 4 nights. We pre-purchased our room on the Sofitel website--which was an excellent rate. We had a wonderful stay in Washington DC. The room was very nice, although it faced an inner courtyard. We were happy with the room because the rate was so reasonable. The room was very clean and the hotel was in a great location. We ate in the hotel and got recs. from the hotel on nearby restaurants--all were exceptional. We took a cab to Georgetown to sample that area and ate at a restaurant recommended by the hotel. Again--great!. The subway stop was just around the corner and the Whitehouse and monuments were within walking distance if you are in reasonable shape. Our first night--we walked to the monuments--highly recommended to see them at night and in the daylight. I left my sunglasses in he room after checkout and the hotel did an exceptional job of helping me replace them. All in all --I would highly recommend this hotel to all --- couple from Washington State
reviews.title: superb experience

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. Fantastic views (we were on the top floor) and absolutely quiet. Room was spacious, well appointed and good options - including DVD, CD, etc. The lobby area is small with options for fine dining or bistro. Bistro food is good but the staff are a little inconsistent (good and bad ones). The fine dining is good, simple and well staffed. As is the front desk staff. Overall, enjoyable hotel, easy access to everything (and walking to most sites and locations as well), subway stop about 5 minute walk away, and well located slightly north of the Whitehouse.
reviews.title: Great rooms

reviews.text: I booked this hotel because it came up as the best sub $300 / night Washington Hotel on Trip advisor, but breakfast and internet will take you over this budget. With supper and drinks in the bar, breakfast & internet it cost me $381.28.
reviews.title: Shame they lost my booking!

likes.liked: — The only hotel on this trip to provide seperate bath & shower

reviews.text: I would have stayed two nights, but despite receiving a confirmation email, they lost my booking and moved me to the Willard InterContinental which is definately a better hotel, despite what the other reviewers say!
reviews.title: First Class - For Real!!

likes.disliked: — No free wireless in room, but free in business center.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is everything to love about this place (unless you need a swim.) I did not eat here but stayed 4 nights (TH-SU) of total comfort and cleanliness and friendliness (great bathroom.) Everything I needed, especially the greatest location two blocks from White House, Old Ebbit Grill, K Street, one block to Metro, fastest-never-waited-elevators. Very Nice - worth whatever you pay (look for deals) and nothing to complain about unless you are a 'never happy' weirdo. I even spared the silly wireless fees by using the free computers in the business center. Keep up the great job, Sofitel DC personnel.
reviews.title: Excellent property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This past weekend we enjoyed a fantastic stay at The Sofitel in Washington DC. From check-in to check-out everything was exactly as I wanted it to be. This was our first visit to DC so we utilized our concierges a lot, they were very helpful and offered great advice on how to spend our short amount of time in DC. The lobby area is very elegant, lots of dark wood, orchids, etc. There was a lounge area where you could get coffee each morning on your way out to sightsee and also a very nice restaurant where we enjoyed breakfasts, loved the complimentary smoothies that they offered there.
reviews.title: Exactly What I Was Looking For!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose the Sofitel for the location, we wanted to be able to walk to the White House whenever we felt like it. The hotel is also a short walk to the Washington Monument and the Smithsonian museums. Our room was beautiful, a comfy king bed, we had a view of the city. Everything was first-class and the bathroom was stunning. A huge soaking tub, glass shower, lovely amenities, lots of granite countertop space for your things. There is also a nice sized HD TV in the room and I loved our view of the city from our room.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in a great location

reviews.text: It is very convenient to catch a cab from this hotel, they usually had a couple of them parked outside of the hotel, we used them a lot of rides to restaurants and Arlington Cemetery. When we return again to the area, we will stay at The Sofitel. Our room was under $200 a night also, we had a King Deluxe room which was perfect. I highly recommend this hotel while visiting our nation's capitol. :)
reviews.title: Excellent Location and First Class Service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sofitel is located in a very pretty part of Washington. Very quiet amongst tree lined streets, but also very close to everything. A walk to the White House and the Mall is easy and interesting and it has two subway stops and a stop for the Circulator within a block, which makes getting around the city very easy.
reviews.title: Lovely, very clean hotel. 4 1/2 stars.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a junior suite which was large and elegantly furnished. We felt very comfortable and pampered in the room, although note that these rooms face the internal courtyard which means looking at brick walls. They are also close to the elevators and we seemed to notice the associated noise from about 7am to 10pm.
reviews.title: Please read before booking (and you likely still will)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed three nights at Sofitel last week. We were underwhelmed with check-in. First night there was no top sheet on the bed only a thin comforter. We called and a sheet was dropped off for us to make our bed, as there was no housekeeping staff available. The third night, same deal, no top sheet on the bed. We were too tired to wait so we slept under the comforter that I'm guessing is not launderd after every guest - ick. The bed felt "broken down" and not anywhere near as comfortable as a Westin or Hilton bed. The lighting in the bathroom was horrible, it made airplane lightening look good. There were hand rails everywhere and two showers so we figured we were in a handicap room. The windows did not open and the room was stuffy and hot. We had to keep the air on high at the lowest temperature to make it comfortable. The room was equiped with ONE small bottle of water and ONE robe and this continued each day. We thought that was a little odd for a king room. The view was pathetic, it was like a prison view, three concrete walls and the dirty roof top. I guess I had expected more since we had booked this reservation months in advance. The clock radio was not a CD player and it didn't pick up one station. The location is miserable if you are looking for any food or toiletries. We were forced to pay $10 for a bottle of Evian in the bar one night because there is just nothing near by on foot. The location is a little more than a block to the MacPherson subway station. Be advised the subway station does not open before 7:15 a.m. on Saturday. The White House is about two blocks from the hotel and you certainly can't see it from the hotel. With the subway system you are not far from anything in this town regardless where you stay. We asked the concierge if she had a map of Reagan Airports layout and she replied "no". That was pretty much the only contact we had with her. There is one restaurant across the street, a steakhouse, and three tourists on the street advised us not to eat there. There are three computers near check-in desk that are available to guests 24/7, that was very much appreciated. However, how this hotel is ranked as high as it is, is a mystery.
reviews.title: Total Disappointment...

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for three nights while attending a conference. Although my employer was paying for the hotel, I just want to remark that, in my view, the rate ($400 per night for the standard room) was too high in my opinion. I would not have paid that amount if I were paying for the room.
reviews.title: good location and nice decor, some problems with service

reviews.text: The location is great, right next to the Lafayette park behind the White House. The hotel lobby is very small, but pleasant. I used the internet a couple of times and did not have to wait.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel for tourists...or even for a wedding reception

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The check-in was fast (no line at 7pm on Tuesday). I asked for a room with a view, if possible. I was given one on the 4th floor (no view), right next to the elevators and opposite the ice machine. I did not hear much noise throughout my stay, but I spent a rather small amount of time in the room.
reviews.title: A different experience than most...
Best Hotel Ever
reviews.text: The gym is in the basement and is adequate. There are towels, fruit, and water there. The machines have TVs.

I stayed at the Sofitel for one night of a hectic business trip. I was upgraded to a larger room upon arrival. The bedding and shower were amazing. The hotel offered several bonuses for business travelers- direct dial phone number and they did not charge for my incoming faxes. I have stayed at several other D.C.-area hotels and the Sofitel was the best thus far. I will stay again.
reviews.title: Slice of heaven for a weary traveler

reviews.text: The Sofitel has pluses and minuses:
reviews.title: Good but Not Great
If your going to the National Mall....
reviews.text: Pluses:
1. Location: Close to subway and attractions.
reviews.title: Good location, Friendly Staff
Very posh home away from home
reviews.text: 2. Rooms: Are small but new, well appointed, have great beds, and have good bathroom separate shower and small tub.
This hotel is amazing.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel

reviews.text: Primary purpose of trip was for business.
reviews.title: probably the best hotel in dc

reviews.text: The location is excellent, only 2 blocks from white house.
reviews.title: Sofitel in DC is well located, great service, and amazing rooms!

likes.liked: — The comfortable bed and amazing service

reviews.text: The room is very modern, and very clean. It's really nice when you are travelling for work and alone and away from home to stay somewhere that feels bright, modern, and clean.
reviews.title: Another class act by Sofitel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed is amazingly comfortable. You'll have a great nights sleep.
reviews.title: Frightening stay.

reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights at the Washington Sofitel; the hotel is situated in a great place to explore all the main sites of D.C.. The White House is one block away, the Mall and it's museums are about a 15 minute walk. There is a subway station about 3 min walk away. The hotel is very clean and staff very efficient and mostly friendly. Rooms are a decent size with a nice big bathroom with shower and separate bath. Big LCD TV, BOSE clock radio are always a plus.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location for D.C. sites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we tried the restaurant twice food was of a high quality and the service was very professional and friendly. Room service meals were very substantial and also of a high quality. Free tea and coffee in the bar in the mornings is a nice way to start the day!
reviews.title: Should Have Asked for a Room with a View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Downsides: Those stupid fridges that automatically charge you when you remove (or even pick up and look at) items. Area is a bit dead after business hours and on the weekend with most premises closed. No free internet.
reviews.title: Boutique hotel in great location

reviews.text: We recently stayed here for two nites and altho we loved the hotel overall I would be remiss if I didn't mention the situation with the views. Not only did we not have a view,which is tolerable, but when we opened out drapes we were no further than 30 feet away from the office building next door and I could read the computers! It made me feel a little closed in since I had to have at least the sheers closed at all times. I had not read the previous review where they asked for a room with a view and got it. The other couple traveling with us had the same issue altho they were on a higher floor. We both booked several months in advance directly with the hotel and paid a premium price so I have to say that was a bit of a disappointment. Other than that, the room and the hotel were great. The room was average size and laid out nicely and yes, the bed was wonderful. The bathroom was a great bonus with a separate tub and shower but I felt the shower was quite small and I am not a big person. The bar downstairs is a hopping place and we visited it both nights and it was a nice respite from the bad weather.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks again, TripAdvisor reviewers...you did not steer me wrong with your favorable Sofitel ratings. This is what I would consider a boutique hotel although there are other locations. By the time we arrived late, the hotel didn't have many rooms left as it was sold out. We got a room on the second floor. If you are looking for a hotel to have a view, you don't want to stay here. However, all other aspects of the hotel are what my husband and I look for...quaint, stylish, friendly service.
reviews.title: Nice
Walk anywhere from here
reviews.text: Clean, you can walk to most ot the places you want to see. 2 minutes walk from the White House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we decided to visit Washington I booked our flights and then looked at hotel prices and was surprised at how expensive they were! Apart from New York we have always stayed in great hotels in the US for under £100 a night so I was suprised when the same standard hotels were nearer £200 in Washington. However once you get past the price, we really enjoyed staying at the Sofitel and in comparison with other hotels at similar prices I think we made the best choice.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: When we arrived the receptionist was very friendly and made us feel welcome straight away. Room was a really good size and although no view this was not a problem. However we were next to what I believe was a service road so I was woken on a few occasions due to deliveries/collections. Loved the bathroom too with separate shower. The lady on concierge was really good too and booked us some good restaurants and the guys out front always said hello and were happy to chat with you. Location was perfect for sight seeing and we walked to everywhere we wanted to see except Georgetown. Also good room service which we tried a few times as too tired from walking to go out!!
reviews.title: Plush European Styling & Comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reason I have marked this as a 4 is we had numerous problems with the safe which became frustrating, also asked for a paper a few times and was never delivered plus being woken up by noise outside. Minor things and I would still go back.
reviews.title: Flawless service / great beds / good location

reviews.text: This hotel is absolutely gorgeous, from lobby to individual guest rooms. The guest room I stayed in had no outside view to speak of, but the room itself was fabulous - extremely roomy, with a huge bathroom (separate tub and shower) and very comfortable bed. The colors and art were very European modern, with lots of warm wood throughout.
reviews.title: Impeccable quality and service - fantastic hotel in DC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We picked the hotel due to its review on Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed! The room was great, much bigger than the usual size for
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great city!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: a city centre hotel. The decor and amenities are also great! Then of course you have the location, which you can beat. The hotel is so close to all major attractions but still on a street which is fairly quiet.
reviews.title: As good as the other reviews say

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have a couple of little minor points but it certainly wouldn’t stop
reviews.title: great location with good breakfast, fine dining & friendly service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: us from returning again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Firstly the hotel is in a ‘U’ shape which means a lot of the rooms face inwards (no street view) and so all you can see is the room opposite. If you’re on a lower floor this restricts light into the rooms and therefore our room was a little dark and we needed the light on in the daytime.
reviews.title: WOW!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After travelling from Melbourne for many hours I made it on March 30 and left April 4 The beds were fantastic, so were the toiletries, the concierge great (he organised and we paid people to line up for tickets that we would have to have been there at 6am !) but it stops there ! The heating was appaling and we actually slept one night with the door wedged open as it was too late to request any changes. Ended up getting a cold due to crazy heating/cooling. The next day I spoke to the customer relations manager and we were moved and appropriate changes were made to the bill. The free internet in lobby area worked for one day out of 4 , the food in the breakfast restaurant very very expensive, and despite being a Privelege member (signed up before we left) we were not given the welcome deal until we asked. Stay at Sofitel? again not really after this experience.
reviews.title: Some parts ok

reviews.text: Great location, great cheap lunch places nearby to eat such as a Loebs, great Jewish run cafe/diner/New York Deli with great soup and sandwiches,Georgia Browns restaurant ok and had signed up online as a member before hand and got a main course (entree) for free with a voucher.
reviews.title: Terrible food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dined at The Willard for the once in a lifetime of amazement. Our Prime Minister Mr Howard stays here it is just so beautiful ! The food was oustanding and so was the service. It was US$201 for 2 with food and wine and just stunning with personalised menus to boot !
reviews.title: Pretty good

likes.disliked: — Location in business area is very quiet on weekends

reviews.text: Found a Filenes, Borders and Ann Taylor so I was happy. Washington great and the cherry blossoms were the best. Lots of people but who cares ?
reviews.title: Loved the Sofitel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: after reading only good reviews on this hotel we decided to give it a try. One night we went with room service and it was nothing short of terrible. I did not know a restaurant such as this would use frozen french fries. When we complained we were offered a refund and then this was taken away. Although the majority of staff (and Washingtonians) were very helpful and polite the managers at the hotel are inept and inefficient. despite my efforts they refused to resolve the issue and whilst the hotel's placement is excellent , I have tasted better food at McDonalds.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Sofitel

likes.disliked: — Slow bar service and lack of Concierge knowledge

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed there for 3 nights and we were very satisfied. The room overlooked the courtyard area (i.e. no view), but we were tired, there on business and the solitude and quiet was perfect for relaxing after a long day. The bed was comfortable and the attention to detail in terms of outfitting the room was quite nice. The crown moulding, the layout of the bathroom and the placement of the bathroom to the common area was well thought out. The room was small-ish but very comfortable. The only reason this did not receive an excellent rating is due to the stains on the carpet. However, I must add that the slippers that were supplied made this a non-issue. The bathrobe (only 1 - why?) was very clean as were the linens. The staff was very friendly, compentent and professional. We ate in the hotel's bar for a quick lunch and it was above average. The location was excellent if one is there as a tourist. The concierge supplied us with appointments at a spa nearby so the fact that there isn't a spa on the premises is not an issue. We would defintely stay there again. Didn't see a single child during our stay - nice, quiet, clean. Good for a business trip and/or peace, quiet and comfort.
reviews.title: Sofitel - yes, will stay there again

reviews.text: Stayed here on business for 6 nights and can't say enough good things about the Sofitel....wonderful room, services, and ammenities, not to mention the enjoyable bar and food services. My room was quiet and well maintained while I was out on business in such a great city. Everyone I encountered (staff) was gracious and willing to help with anything I needed. A wonderful experience.....I'll definitely return!
reviews.title: Life IS Magnifique!

reviews.text: I stayed here on business for 7 nights, and it is a superb hotel. After nearly 30 hours flying or in airports from Australia, it was so good to walk into a hotel where the staff were so polite, courteous, warm and helpful. Nothing is too much trouble here - I have made full use of a range of services (room service, housekeeping, laundry service, internet service) and they have been almost completely faultless.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had one minor issue with delayed return of laundry, and when I complained, the staff bent over backwards to deliver my clean laundry as soon as possible, and did not charge for the laundry by way of compensation.
reviews.title: the schizophrenic sofitel

likes.disliked: — inconsistencies in service and housekeeping services

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room service meals are generous and even at 1am, when I couldn't sleep and ordered a hot chocolate, the service was prompt and a HUGE jug of steaming hot chocolate was delivered to my room.
reviews.title: Well located
Good location - lacks basic amenities
reviews.text: Hotel is very clean with friendly staff. There appears to be a language barrier with housekeeping though and they do not knock before entering your room - they walked in when we were in there twice which could have been embarrassing. Luckily it wasn't!

One BIG ISSUE with this hotel is that there are NO tea or coffee making facilities in the rooms. In my opinion this is very poor and I expected more. One good thing though and unexpected is that there is a separate bath and shower. This is great.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, perfect location.

reviews.text: One thing is that the area is VERY expensive and all restaurants in the area are pricey.
reviews.title: Sofitel Light

reviews.text: I'm not sure I would stay here again - location is good but I like to 'experience' cities and you cannot do that here.
reviews.title: Great stay in DC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a beautiful boutique hotel. Conveniently located and a very short walk from the White House. Staff are exceptional, rooms are fabulous and service is fantastic. Loved this place and will definitely stay again.
reviews.title: French and so DC...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel on Aug 3-5 for an anniversary getaway. I booked this hotel in particular because it was rated #1 on Tripadvisor at the time I planned the trip. The hotel was very clean and the bathroom did not disappoint. The separate tub and shower were wonderful and the bed was more comfortable than ours at home. My husband's only complaint was that we did not have a top sheet for the bed, just a comforter, and the size of the room was a bit small. I joined the Sofitel member program thinking that would get us an upgraded room, as advertised, but apparently you have to be a "gold" member to receive most of the perks including the upgraded room.
reviews.title: Okay at the Sofitel

likes.liked: — Location and cleanliness; the comfortable bed, bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location could not have been better. There was a Starbucks on the opposite corner and it was only a short walk to the Mall area. Old Ebbit's Grill is about a block away and the food there was excellent and reasonably priced. We really did not see anyone in the hotel restaurant, but that may have been because it was during the weekend and the hotel seemed to cater to a more business crowd. We ordered late night dessert (cheesecake and chocolate mud pie) for room service one evening and it was really good and quick.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, it was a nice stay. I had hoped our anniversary would have been acknowledged since it was mentioned when I booked, but I guess we are not that lucky when it comes to occassion upgrades, etc.
reviews.title: the best

likes.disliked: — too comfy, didn't want to get out of bed

reviews.text: The hotel room is nicely decorated and is a good size for a big city hotel room. Bedding is nice and the bathroom has a separate glass shower and bath tub.
reviews.title: just OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is very close to the White House. I found that I could walk to most places in 15-20 min or easily take the metro. The metro stop is only one block away.
reviews.title: Ideal location, super ambience

likes.liked: — Very quiet, no noise from adjacent rooms. Extremely comfortable bed. Super ambience throughout.

aka: Sofitel Washington Dc Hotel Washington Dc
description: Sofitel Washington DC Lafayette Square represents one of the most exclusive locations in the nation's capital. Discover this contemporary downtown Washington DC hotel, situated at the corner of Lafayette Square, bordering the White House. Our downtown DC hotel accommodations occupy an updated historic landmark, first erected in 1880. Celebrate Sofitel's "art de vivre" within this luxury hotel in downtown Washington DC - marked by distinctive style, superb cuisine, and incomparable service.
